definition[0]: a large noisy crowd, especially one that is angry and violent
example[0]: They were immediately surrounded by the mob.
example[1]: The leadership had been criticized for giving in to mob rule  (=when a mob controls the situation rather than the government or the law).
example[2]: a mob of a few hundred demonstrators
definition[1]: a group of people of the same type
example[3]: What happens if they send the heavy mob round to find him?
example[4]: The usual mob of teenagers were standing on the corner.
definition[2]: if people mob a famous person, they rush to get close to them and form a crowd around them
example[5]: Fans ran onto the pitch and mobbed the batsman.
definition[3]: if a group of birds or animals mob another bird or animal, they all attack it
